intro: Microtatorchis chaetophora, commonly known as the hairy thread moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy structures called rhizoids. The leaves are narrow and elongated, often with a distinct midrib, and they are arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. This moss typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on stalks and release spores when mature.
